FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: SCHEDULE N, PART II: DISPOSITION OF ASSETS
ExplntnTxt: THE COLLEGE FORMALLY CEASED ITS OPERATIONS DURING THE PRIOR FISCAL YEAR. DURING THE CURRENT FISCAL YEAR, THE COLLEGE EMBARKED UPON A PROCESS TO DISPOSE OF ITS ASSETS, PRINCIPALLY THREE PARCELS OF REAL ESTATE. THE PROCEEDS FROM THE SALE OF REAL ESTATE WAS TO BE USED TO SATISFY THE RESPECTIVE MORTGAGES ON THE PROPERTIES AND TO SATISFY OTHER LIABILITIES THAT THE COLLEGE HAD INCURRED, AN EXAMPLE OF WHICH WOULD BE REIMBURSEMENT TO THE STATE OF MINNESOTA FOR UNEMPLOYMENT BENEFITS PAID TO THOSE WHO LOST THEIR JOBS. THE COLLEGE CONTINUED TO MAINTAIN CERTAIN RECORDS, MOSTLY EMPLOYMENT AND FINANCIAL IN NATURE. DURING THE YEAR, THE COLLEGE WAS SUCCESSFUL IN SELLING TWO OF ITS THREE PARCELS OF REAL ESTATE, THE PROCEEDS OF WHICH WENT TO SATISFY THE RESPECTIVE MORTGAGES ON THE PROPERTY AND TO PAY OTHER LIABILITIES.ALL TRANSACTIONS OCCURED AT ARMS-LENGTH AND NO CONFLICTS OF INTEREST WERE DETERMINED IN THE SALE OF THE ORGANIZATION'S ASSETS.
THIS ORGANIZATION CEASED TO EXIST WHEN THE ORIGANIZER PASSED AWAY IN 2014. THERE WERE NO ASSETS TO SELL OR DISTRIBUTE.

PERSON(S) INVOLVED: AS OF JANUARY 1, 2014, POLYTECHNIC MERGED INTO NEW YORK UNIVERSITY. THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUALS BECAME EMPLOYEES OF NYU:MARY COWMANKURT BECKERDENNIS DINTINOROBERT UBELLRICHARD THORSENWALTER ZURAWSKYIRAJ KALKHORANJONATHAN CHAOSUNIAL KUMARNASIR MEMONKEITH ROSSCHARLES TAPIEROKATEPALLI SREENIVASAN
AS OF JANUARY 1, 2014 THE SERIES 2007 IDA BONDS BECAME AN OBLIGATION OF NEW YORK UNIVERSITY.

FrmAndLnRfrncDsc: Sch N, Part III, Additional Information
ExplntnTxt: THE SCHOOL EITHER RETURNED OR ATTEMPTED TO RETURN ALL DONATED ASSETS TO THE ORIGINAL DONOR(S). ASSETS THAT WERE NOT ORIGINALLY A DONATED ITEM OR WERE UNABLE TO BE RETURNED TO THE ORIGINAL DONOR WERE DONATED TO OTHER NOT FOR PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS, SOLD, OR AUCTIONED. ITEMS THAT WERE SOLD OR AUCTIONED RESULTED IN GROSS PROCEEDS TOTALING $19,563.

THE COLLEGE CONTRIBUTED CASH AND CERTAIN REAL PROPERTY AND IMPROVEMENTS, INCLUDING A PORTION OF THE REAL PROPERTY GENERALLY KNOWN AS THE "MCNAIR CAMPUS", THE HOSPITAL/CLINIC BUILDING LOCATED ON The MCNAIR CAMPUS (EXCEPT FOR A PORTION OF THE TOP FIVE FLOORS TO BE USED FOR the COLLEGE'S CLINICAL OPERATIONS AND A CONFERENCE CENTER ON THE FIRST FLOOR). IN EXCHANGE, THE COLLEGE RECEIVED A 35 PERCENT MEMBERSHIP INTEREST IN CHI ST. LUKE'S HEALTH BAYLOR COLLEGE OF MEDICINE MEDICAL CENTER, A TEXAS NON-PROFIT CORPORATION EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL INCOME TAX UNDER SECTION 501(A) OF THE CODE, AS AN ORGANIZATION DESCRIBED IN SECTION 501(C)(3). SCHEDULE N, PART II, LINE 1c Buildings & Improvements $ 108,000,000 Land $ 92,600,000 Equipment $ 40,500,000 Intangible - Use of BCM trade name $ 51,000,000 Cash $ 33,000,000 Jamail ASC assets $ 4,900,000 Total assets transferred $ 330,000,000 SCHEDULE N, PART II, LINE 1F CHI ST. LUKE'S HEALTH BAYLOR COLLEGE OF MEDICINE MEDICAL CENTER IS THE FULL NAME OF THE NEW TEXAS NON PROFIT CORPORATION EXEMPT FROM FEDERAL TAX UNDER 501(c)(3) OF THE CODE. SCHEDULE N, PART II, LINE 2E WAYNE KEATHLEY, A FORMER KEY EMPLOYEE OF BAYLOR COLLEGE OF MEDICINE AND LISTED ON FORM 990, PART VII, SECTION A, IS PRESIDENT OF CHI ST. LUKE'S BAYLOR COLLEGE OF MEDICINE MEDICAL CENTER. WAYNE KEATHLEY WILL RECEIVE COMPENSATION FOR HIS ROLE AS PRESIDENT OF THIS ORGANIZATION.
